chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly Lynn Garza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:11 AM Defendant Kimberly Lynn Garza in court.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria in court for Kimberly Lynn Garza.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Court orders sentence withheld 2 years probation. Costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit zero days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.
